intro: Reseda tefedestica, commonly known as the narrow-leaved reseda, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia. Its leaves are linear and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers are typically arranged in racemes. Reseda tefedestica is often found in meadows, roadsides, and other open habitats where it thrives in full sun.
